channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Berkshire Hathaway's operating earnings jump 20%, conglomerate buys back another $1 billion in stock
item.description: Berkshire Hathaway posted a solid gain in operating profits during the third quarter despite rising recession fears.

item.title: An extraordinary comeback for Brazil’s Lula sees a new ‘pink tide’ take shape in Latin America
item.description: A remarkable return to the presidency for Brazil's Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva heralds a new "pink tide" in Latin America.

item.title: In bankrupt Lebanon, locals mine bitcoin and buy groceries with tether, as $1 is now worth 15 cents
item.description: As Lebanon's economy spirals into hyperinflation, locals explain how cryptocurrency has replaced a financial system that no longer makes sense.

item.title: Twitter co-founder Dorsey apologizes for growing the company 'too quickly' in wake of mass layoffs
item.description: Twitter co-founder Jack Dorsey apologized Saturday for growing the company "too quickly," a day after hundreds of employees were laid off under Elon Musk.

item.title: Climate activists swarm private jets at Amsterdam airport to protest pollution
item.description: Hundreds of climate activists swarmed a private jet section of Amsterdam's Schiphol Airport on Saturday as part of a day of demonstrations in and around the airport.

item.title: Markets need to 're-anchor their thinking': Bank of England chief economist hints that traders have it wrong
item.description: BOE Chief Economist Huw Pill suggested that recent disturbances in the U.K. economy had distorted market expectations for future interest rate hikes.

item.title: Retailers have a new holiday headache — people are spending their money on travel
item.description: The peak shopping season will test spending priorities of consumers who are facing high inflation.

item.title: The new European vacation? Travelers are returning for trips that are all about food and wine
item.description: Travelers who have "done" Paris, visited Tuscany and toured the U.K.'s picturesque Cotswolds region are returning to explore the food, rather than the sites.

item.title: How the CNBC Stock World Cup 2022 works
item.description: If you invest today, which of the two companies going head-to-head will give you a greater total return over the next 12 months? We ask experts.

item.title: Why Apple raised the price of the iPhone, but not in the U.S. and China
item.description: Apple's newest iPhones came with price increases in some countries but not the U.S. due to the impact of a strong U.S. dollar and currency headwinds.

item.title: What it feels like to visit a fusion company lab on a day when wildfire smoke cloaks the horizon
item.description: I visited Helion Energy in Everett, Washington, on October 20th when wildfire smoke was making it dangerous to be outside. Here's what that felt like.

item.title: Do new Covid 'Scrabble' variants make omicron boosters pointless? Here's what experts say
item.description: Shortly after new omicron Covid boosters were introduced, the 'Scrabble' variants emerged. Experts weigh in on how the updated vaccines may fare against them.

item.title: DraftKings shares tumble after monthly users fall short of estimates
item.description: DraftKings stock fell as much as 26% on Friday despite the sports betting company posting higher-than-expected revenue for its third-quarter earnings report.

item.title: Tesla stock has dropped more than 35% since Elon Musk first said he'd buy Twitter
item.description: The world's richest man has a lot on his plate.

item.title: Opinion: Ron Baron explains his investing philosophy with goal of doubling his money every 5 to 6 years
item.description: Baron Capital founder Ron Baron said investing during the tumultuous 1970s was foundational to his investing approach.

item.title: Web inventor Tim Berners-Lee wants us to 'ignore' Web3: 'Web3 is not the web at all'
item.description: Berners-Lee said people too often conflate Web3 with "Web 3.0," his own proposal for reshaping the internet.

item.title: It's a 'wild west out there': CEO says regulation needed to keep firms in line on sustainability
item.description: Tuuli-Anna Tiuttu made her comments during an interview for CNBC's Sustainable Future Forum.

item.title: A showdown over climate reparations is brewing — and it will determine the success of the COP27 summit
item.description: Climate reparations — sometimes referred to as "loss and damage" payments — is a core issue likely to dominate proceedings at the COP27 summit.

item.title: Here's what we know about the rebound in Chinese stocks this week
item.description: Chinese stocks rallied this week as investors hoped Beijing would soon relax its stringent Covid policy.

item.title: Magic mushroom compound psilocybin can help treat depression, study finds
item.description: The psychedelic compound psilocybin can significantly reduce symptoms of depression, according to data from the largest trial of its type ever conducted.

item.title: Coinbase criticizes Singapore's crypto regulations, urges city-state to embrace retail trading
item.description: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong said Singapore's views on crypto are "incompatible, in my mind."

item.title: Debt rules in Europe are changing. And that could have big repercussions in the bond markets
item.description: The need to correct fiscal stances becomes ever more relevant at a time of war in Europe, an energy crisis and severe cost-of-living pressures.

item.title: Germany's dependence on China is 'overblown,' but critical goods diversification needs to improve: EU Chamber of Commerce
item.description: President of the EU Chamber of Commerce in China Joerg Wuttke said many of Germany's imports from China are replaceable.

item.title: Hong Kong Rugby Sevens is back. Rugby union says demand is high despite Covid measures
item.description: "Those restrictions are there but I don't think it takes away from the key ingredients of the Sevens —which is great rugby, entertainment and a fun weekend," Brooke said.

item.title: AirAsia X on strong footing, Capital A to benefit as economy tightens, CEO Tony Fernandes says
item.description: The positive outlook comes in spite of negative market reactions to Fernandes' resignation as AirAsia X's Group CEO this week.

item.title: Barclays cuts China GDP outlook after forecasting U.S., Europe recession
item.description: Barclays cut its forecast for China's economic growth next year to 3.8%, based partly on expectations of a drop in global demand for Chinese goods.

item.title: JPMorgan's blockchain unit CEO says consumer protection needs to be a priority in digital asset projects
item.description: "What a bank needs to do from a regulatory point of view and customer's point of view is that we need to protect our customers," said Onyx CEO Umar Farooq.

item.title: Toho plans to release a new Japanese Godzilla film next year as the monster's audience grows
item.description: Godzilla made its mark on the film industry 68 years ago, and the monster’s reign is growing more powerful due to streaming.

item.title: U.S. Commerce Secretary Raimondo doubles down on Biden plan to restrict American companies, and citizens, from helping China make semiconductor chips
item.description: Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo backs the Biden administration's new rules against U.S. companies and citizens helping China manufacture semiconductors.

item.title: China's Covid controls are pushing companies to diversify away from a 'start-stop economy'
item.description: A Covid outbreak at Apple supplier Foxconn's factory shows the continued challenges factories face in trying to maintain operations while preventing infections.
